title._content: Tigger in Sugar Mill Gardens, c.2008

description._content:
I've had a request from a friend to post some of the pics I have of Tigger back in Sugar Mill Gardens, where he lived when I "met" him. 

This is right next to the old ruins, where I first laid eyes on him. It was a favorite place of Tigger's. He used to lay on and under a bench just to the right, which he used to keep cool in the summer.

 I wonder what he'd think of the place now that so much has changed? They've covered the ruins, and I imagine, had he lived there after they did that, he would have loved it, He would have had some shelter there. As it was, there was only a little, open gazebo roof for Tig to use when it rained.

 For years he had no bed, no blanket, no creature comforts other than a bowl of food which was often eaten by raccoons, or some water they dirtied up dunking the food into! All that changed after January 2008, when I saw this phenomenal animal needed some TLC, and with help from the folks on Flickr, I got him the care he needed. When a horrible storm threatened, I got him out of there, and kept him as part of my family from then on. I will miss him dreadfully now that he's gone....
